page.title: 07INTERESTING PLACES
page.content: {Kilkhampton Church:}The patron saint of the parish church is St.James,the brother of John the Evangelist.He is also the patron saint of Spain and all pilgrims.In 1752 the four bells were melted down and made into five.In 1860 another bell was added by Lord John Thynne,In March 1948,the treble and second were added making a peal of eight.The treble in thankfullness for victory in the recent war and the second in memory of the late rector, the Rev.Roderick Dew.The organ was a gift from the late Lord John Thynne and is now one of the finest in the westcountry {Helen Cook { Other places include{Penstowe manor,} {, Aldercombe farm}and the{Methodist {chapel { }
